website_summaries.verdict: A preamplifier that offers a perfect addition to any turntable setup.
pros: Compatible with most moving magnet cartridges
Includes advanced circuitry that keeps noise and distortion low
Boasts a metallic case and outboard DC power supply that help reduce the risk of electromagnetic interference
RCA input and output sockets are gold-plated to preserve sound quality
cons: Left channel sometimes stops working after limited use

customer_reviews.title: Asounding!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I have a rather pedestrian turntable from TEAC with a really good Ortofon blue cartridge and a built in amp and by sheer instinct (and knowing Pro-ject's reputation) I went for this and I'm astounded by the improvement in sound. It went from one rather bland shade to an explosion of color and depth. I'm finally hearing the essence of what vinyl connoisseurs have been preaching about for years. This is an AMAZING product. A MUST HAVE.
customer_reviews.author: David Simon

customer_reviews.title: And, you be the judge
customer_reviews.text: Purchased hoping it would be better than the 20 dollar one made by Pyle....well, dissapointed. Possibly got a little more output gain, but not significantly noticeable to my ears. Now, of course, others may differ, but this is my opinion. So, save yourself some money, try the cheaper one first and you be the judge.
customer_reviews.author: Laoblue

customer_reviews.title: Didn't function
customer_reviews.text: I've heard a lot of good things about this phono amp, but right out of the box mine didn't work. Literally plugged it up after opening the package, and nothing. I basically spent $80 bucks on a paperweight. After further investigation, I learned that I'm not the only one to have that happen. Apparently it's hit and miss. I expected more for the price, and for the fact that it's made in Germany . If you get one that works, it supposed to be a superior product . I wouldn't know. I'm not gambling on it again, I'll be looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Sid Scurlock

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound
customer_reviews.text: Static electricity blew out one phono input so I decided to try a preamp instead of a new power source. The preamp was easy to connect and worked with a slight hum. The problem was that it did not reproduce any lows or highs. Everything was mid range. My subwoofer was inaudible during playback. This product was returned and I purchased an Outlaw receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: A pre-amp for Debut Carbon
customer_reviews.text: First pre-amp for my second turntable (debut carbon). I hooked up everything with no issues. Put on a record and great sounding music poured out of the speakers. I can't compare this to other pre-amps but it works great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Triggs

customer_reviews.title: Great little pre-amp
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use, simple to set up - provides multiple types of socket connectors. Was packaged very well and gives the feeling of a sturdy reliable product. It has a strong casing and ground wire. We connected to a Pro-Ject Elemental record player and produces a great sound!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: A pre-amp that does what it's supposed to do at a reasonable cost.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Only suggestion would be to put an on/off switch on it, cause I'd rather not have it consuming power all the time and I don't like having to unplug it each time I use it. A switch would be great.
customer_reviews.author: Jim P.

customer_reviews.title: The power supply added hum in my system
customer_reviews.text: The small multiple country DC power supply caused noise or hum in my system. I believe there is a correctable product defect if a different power supply were chosen by ProJect. I returned this preamp and purchased a used Moon LP3 for $175 but it is dead quiet and a better preamp with very good specs and components. Rega or Music Fidelity are also very good quiet phono preamps and can be purchased on the used market in the under $75-200 range.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Get something else. Anything else.
customer_reviews.text: Can’t believe they have the audacity to ask $75 For this noise box. Nasty noise it produces no matter where I tried grounding my TT, or where I plugged in the preamp. You can’t even get near it because it starts buzzing even louder. I listened to it for about 5 minutes, non stop buzzing, music was was nothing special. The Behringer pp400 is such a better product. I have the pp400 on the turntable I tested the Project on, and it blows it away. And no buzzzzz. Pathetic. Back it went.
customer_reviews.author: OGSERB

customer_reviews.title: Good pre-amp !
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and definitely an improvement over a cheat per adapter that I bought. It has decent sound for high and low frequencies and seems like a solid until. I am giving this a 4 star rating and not 5 because the product arrived with a US bad power supply. The power adapter has connectors for other counties and the US connector was broken, so I had to use the European adapter and then dig around my house for a travel adapter in order to make it work. Poor quality control. Also it has LED to indicate whether this unit is on. That is another -1/2 a star IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Vin

customer_reviews.title: Good compact low noise MM phono preamp
customer_reviews.text: This device is a great substitute to update an aging phono pre-amp stage in Vintage audio equipment. It's much quieter than my original (1970's vintage) MM phono stage. However at $80.00 its not cheap. I'm impressed with the fact that the enclosure is small and all metal with a ground connector (required for vintage tonearms). Attached equipment: SME 3009 tonearm, Shure V-15 (type V) cartridge, Sony TA-2000f Pre-amp. Monster cable interconnects.
customer_reviews.author: J. J. Techead

customer_reviews.title: Good Improvement
customer_reviews.text: I needed a Phono Pre-Amp for my receiver since the built in one strangely stopped working. I thought this would be a worthy improvement since I just purchased the Pro-Ject Debut Carbon DC. Everything sounds beautiful and a fantastic upgrade from my older setup!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great phono preamp.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to replace the built-in phono preamp on my Audio Technica AT-LP60 turntable. What a difference! Also, bought a used one, so saved a significant amount. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Barry Kempker

customer_reviews.title: Great for adding turntable to receiver with no phono input.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a newer receiver with no phono inputs and want to connect a turntable, this is what you need. I have a Pro-Ject turntable so chose this one because I knew it would be great quality. My albums sound great!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: and I am delighted at the sound from my 20 year old Denon ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not any kind of expert or audiophile, but I have a ( too Large) collection of vinyl jazz and opera, some purchased almost 50 years ago, and I am delighted at the sound from my 20 year old Denon turntable with this relatively inexpensive pre amp and a new cart and stylus.
customer_reviews.author: BLH

customer_reviews.title: Buy something with Volume Control
customer_reviews.text: Maybe this was just a rookie mistake but I purchased this to run through my krk Rokit 5's that I use for producing music. I cannot turn the volume down enough. Even when I turn the volume on the back of my speakers all the way down, it is still extremely loud. The only way I could listen was to run two mic lines into my apogee duet to adjust the volume within my computer software.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful workmanship, scrappy power supply
customer_reviews.text: Great packaging, very substantial weight. Thought it had to be good workmanship! Probably is, but not working. Pulled stereo shelving out to make sure I plugged it into the spot I thought, and I did. Picked up unit off shelf, and heard music! Turned it around to check plugs, sound went out. End of power cord has short. First day I had it. Returning, don't know what I will replace it with.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised, wish it had a volume control
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised, and in that sense it is a very good product for the money. I do wish it had some sort of volume adjustment to boost the signal to the amp tho. Next time I'll spend more to get this feature, and you might want to consider that yourself. You really have to crank the volume on the receiver to listen to your albums.
customer_reviews.author: David E. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Dont have much to compare it to. But it works.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Lieving

customer_reviews.title: Good simple pre-amp, but not loud
customer_reviews.text: It does what it needs to do, and it works perfectly, but it requires that the volume be turned up much higher than all of the other stereo components.
customer_reviews.author: _Pete_

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device to hook up my Technics turntable up to my new AV receiver. I hooked it up and it works very well. I can listen to a lot of my old records now. I didnt know this type of device existed when i bought my last surround sound unit. I am very pleased to recommend this to anyone who wishes to use an old turntable with a new Receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C.

customer_reviews.title: NICES SMALL PHONO PREAMP
customer_reviews.text: PREAMP WORKS GREAT WITH MY MAGNETIC PICKUP. THIS IS THE SECOND PREAMP PURCHASED FORM THIS COMPANY. VERY PLEASED I DIDN'T HAVE TO SPEND $$$$$$
customer_reviews.author: E. GUZZO

customer_reviews.title: Super and simple
customer_reviews.text: To the point, dual mono, stereo phono preamp. No bells, lights, adjustments or anything else, literally. It's a preamp. Nothing more, except for the dual mono...no sharing of circuits, true left and true right, which helps with stereo imaging and is budget friendly.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: and it works great. It was easy to set up as a ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a Debut Carbon III, same manufacturer of this product, and it works great. It was easy to set up as a first time purchaser.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Angoco

customer_reviews.title: Quality unit but didn’t make as big a difference as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.text: Quality product for the price but didn’t really make a big difference in volume or tone with playing vinyl on my Onkyo TX-8270 receiver, (which has a pretty low Phono Input level). If I had to purchase again, I’d probably opt to spend more on a unit that will make a bigger difference over my receiver’s existing Phono input.
customer_reviews.author: Crashtime

customer_reviews.title: It works and sounds good.
customer_reviews.text: To my surprise my Pioneer Elite reciever lacked a phono stage. Connected the Pro Ject Debut Carbon. Sounds really good. Wish I didn't need it though.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: Like it a lot, especially for the price. Still have some hum with solid ground, but very low and not discernable when music is on at any volume.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Goad

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: Not adjustable... amplifies a turntable input... doesn't seem to add any noise. Does what it's supposed to do. Also, it's very small, so doesn't take up shelf space
customer_reviews.author: Ian Miller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Preamp. Great for the Teac TN-350 turntable.
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this preamp as an upgrade for the Teac TN-350 / TN-350-WA. It was a noticeable improvement over the onboard phono preamp and I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for U-Turn Audio turntable and Edifier speakers.
customer_reviews.text: This is phenomenal. I used this to connect my U-turn Audio Turntable to my Edifier S1000DB speakers and it increased the sound 5 fold. After several failed attempts to amplify my phonograph sound through the receiver I caved in and bought this, and I'm extremely happy with the results! Now I can blast my old metal \M/ albums much to the dismay of my wife and children.
customer_reviews.author: Rich nagle

customer_reviews.title: Old turntable, new speakers, good quality preamp
customer_reviews.text: I really like their turntables and was very hesitant on the preamp but it did deliver!! I have an old fisher turntable and bookself active speakers and so all i needed was a preamp and it has done wonders!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: A solid design with great audio.
customer_reviews.text: Not the most attractive thing, but tuck it in the back behind stuff and let it work it's magic. A solid design with great audio.
customer_reviews.author: j cody theilgaard

customer_reviews.title: Great clarity of signal especially at low volume
customer_reviews.text: Fast response and shipping. Great clarity of signal especially at low volume ! Great value for the price. Highly recommend +++++
customer_reviews.author: christopher barber

customer_reviews.title: This works great, at least with my Pro-Ject Debut Carbon DC ...
customer_reviews.text: This works great, at least with my Pro-Ject Debut Carbon DC turntable. Volume is loud and clear. Noticeable difference from my previous preamp.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Works as well as units costing a few hundred more.
customer_reviews.author: Enigmatic

customer_reviews.title: work well with the pro ject turntable. It does ...
customer_reviews.text: work well with the pro ject turntable. It does have some feedback at higher volumes back is drowned out by the music.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and no noise. If you have a low to mid range turntable and speaker set up you'll be very very happy with how this sounds. I'm glad I bought this
customer_reviews.author: CmP

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. Worked as advertised. I needed this since my amplifier does not have a dedicated phono input. I get plenty of volume when playing my records. Sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Andy D.

customer_reviews.title: ... a present for my son for xmas and he love
customer_reviews.text: it was a present for my son for xmas and he love it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product does all that we hoped it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Tom H.

customer_reviews.title: Failed in less than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a few months - allowed me to boost the sound from my record player to my Sonos sytem...until it didn't. Now, all I get is distorted sound from an unusable hockey puck that I can't return.
customer_reviews.author: JRSAustin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hooking up an old technics turntable to a ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for hooking up an old technics turntable to a stereo. Could be a bit lower cost but still affordable. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Twindriver

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: great sound. connected it to an Audio Thechnics lp120 and it is better then the built in pre
customer_reviews.author: alon Stamler

customer_reviews.title: My records sound great to my ears
customer_reviews.text: I really have nothing to compare this to, but it's hooked up to my Debut Carbon, and you'd never know it's there. My records sound great to my ears.So yes, I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pair for Pro-Ject turntable!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Pro-Ject turntable,the Carbon 2M, so this is like a match made in heaven. It was crazy easy to set up (plug and play pretty much) and it immediately corrected audio issues as well as gave me the power of sound that having a turntable requires. This was an afterthought for me as I had purchased a nice player and a nice sound system only to realize I forgot you needed a preamp to make it all sound great and loud. This is the most satisfying purchase i've made in years because of how easy it is to use and effective it is.
customer_reviews.author: GardenSirens

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Brought a 30+ year old turntable and 40+ year old record collection to life. Zero hum! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Pardue

customer_reviews.title: This device works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This device works like a charm. I didn't want to buy a new receiver and this device allows me to play my vinyl and the sound is crisp. No issues to report...
customer_reviews.author: Leslie J. Turner

customer_reviews.title: sounds fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Have it paired up with a Pro-Ject Essential ii in a 2-channel bedroom setup, sounds fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: ingramba

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use and the sound is good. Low noise
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use and the sound is good. Low noise, low distortion. No grounding issues. I don't think you could do better without spend 2 or 3 times as much. I'd definitely recommend this to friends because it is good and reasonably priced. Unless you are using the highest quality stereo system in a finely tuned listening room, this is plenty good for your use case.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Simple to set up and works great.
customer_reviews.text: Worth the price. Simple to set up and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Francisca L Russell

customer_reviews.title: Good solid product
customer_reviews.text: Nice solid little unit. Not much to say, plugged it in and it works. As for sound quality, very nice!
customer_reviews.author: william hafer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pre-amp for the price
customer_reviews.text: I use this pre-amp with my Pro-Ject Debut Carbon, and it has exceeded my expectations. Unless you want to spend $500 and up on a pre-amps, this model will serve you well! No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: OJS

customer_reviews.title: This unit clips audio!
customer_reviews.text: This product is NOT good! Gain is too high through the unit and it clips. There is no adjustment for this provided. I thought I would upgrade my existing preamp with this. I am using a Rega system to record vinyl into a computer sound card. This product is also NOT adjustable for either MM or MC cartridges. It ONLY works for MM. (That is why it has an MM in its name, I guess.) The only way to make this work is to put external potentiometers on both channels to give a way to adjust the levels, which is really not feasable.. I would not buy another and will check different MFGRs.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Crass

customer_reviews.title: Revives an old turntable to be 2018 popular again!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent item! Amplifies the signal coming from the phonograph to the high end multi-unit receiver. I'm using a vintage Sony Linear Tracking Stereo Turntable System PS-FL7 (1982-83). The sound originally sounded very faint and quiet when I plugged into the "CD" input on my receiver. I did not have a "PHONO" option available on my unit. I'm very happy with my purchase and would highly recommend this to anyone wanting go back in time to hear the real songs as they were meant to be heard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Adam

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This worked as we needed it to and it was easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality. Great price. Sounds sweet with a Technics SL-L3 linear tracking turntable.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. No hum. Extremely quiet. No hiss or static. Works great with a Technics SL-L3 linear tracking turntable that has a built in muting circuit. No popping sound that other phono preamps may do with this type of turntable (that I experienced). The Pro-Ject is small and has solid construction. My only complaint is the description of the gain: On the package it says 32 dB but in the owner's manual it said it had 40 dB. It sounded loud enough on my system. Not sure which is correct.
customer_reviews.author: S.E.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to connect. Got the old turntable running in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great and seems well built, the only thing missing is an on/off switch.
customer_reviews.author: Discover

customer_reviews.title: Great Value - Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: I was a tad disappointed when I found out the built-in preamp in my turntable had a hardware noise gate. It kept interfering with my rips, toggling the sound completely on and off before the end of long track fade-outs. Fortunately, my turntable has a switchable output, so I simply fed the phono level outs to this baby and the problem was instantly solved.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Works with my Technics turntable and Yamaha receiver
customer_reviews.text: When I initially connected my Technics Quartz SL-QD33 turntable to a Yamaha HTR5540 AV receiver, I could not get any sound. After some research on the internet, I realized that I needed a pre-amp in order to convert the audio signal from the turntable to the receiver. There are thousands of pre-amps with a wide price range. I decided to give this one a try. Luckily, It works very well. The sound is very clear. The only thing is that I have to crack up the volume of the receive a bit. Overall I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding, simple little preamp.
customer_reviews.text: Using it with my ProJect RM4 with Sumiko Pearl. (Subjectively) It sounds even better than it did through my NAD preamp (C162). I love the simplicity and the sound is wonderful. Overall it's a great value. One quick thing to note: MM only!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel MacCabe

customer_reviews.title: Easy hookup, immediate check and everything was perfect
customer_reviews.text: Got the MM phono receiver/translator. Easy hookup, immediate check and everything was perfect. Great sound from vinyl, and that's what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: David Hoge

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great compact design and works nicely with the pro-ject debut carbon.
customer_reviews.author: Farraz Daudi

customer_reviews.title: good item
customer_reviews.text: Does what it has to do. Be sure you know what db gain your cart. requires before you order a pre-amp.
customer_reviews.author: constant buyer

customer_reviews.title: Awsome Product
customer_reviews.text: Sound is fantastic and quiet. Worked great with my vintage Technics SL-D2 direct drive turntable.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra S.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good product it just dont work with my onkyo-tx nr616
customer_reviews.author: VGjR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Very good product for when you have to add additional length to your phonograph to get a clear signal.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Flynt

customer_reviews.title: Second one worked without issue
customer_reviews.text: The first one didn't work out of the box, but the replacement was fine. The preamp works well enough for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: got our old turn table connected to a new wireless speaker in a snap
customer_reviews.author: JulS

customer_reviews.title: Produces very nice sound playing your records
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pre-amp for your receiver. Paired it with a Pro-Ject Debut Carbon and the sound is phenomenal, even on lower quality receivers. Easy to set up, and a nice compact size to either hide, or blend it in with your system.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works as promised.
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it is supposed to. Transmits better than average audio from our turntable to our soundbar. Come out clear, easy to install. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: KacyD

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does the job for entry level but will definitely be upgrading this in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Madai Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Recommended phone box
customer_reviews.text: Now old turntable works thru new Bose Soundwave and not too expensive
customer_reviews.author: Judi Hotovec

customer_reviews.title: Perfect compact solution.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Very compact. It enables me to listen to my vinyl for the first time in a long time. Love it !
customer_reviews.author: Donald N. Benefiel Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: After 5 months and a few uses, it has completely stopped working. There is no longer any sound being communicates between my receiver and record player. It was working perfectly, and without warning completely stopped. I followed all the instructions about placing it in a good location to avoid malfunction and it still broke quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: ... with a phono box and I couldn't be more pleased! I would love to upgrade to a tube ...
customer_reviews.text: First experience with a phono box and I couldn't be more pleased! I would love to upgrade to a tube phono box at some point, but it will be tough to do being as I can't imagine a much better sound!
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Callahan

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: As a beginner vinyl listener I just needed something to ground my signal as my receiver didn't have a phono input. This did just the job for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ellington

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great price point for the quality of it's output. If your budget isn't big, I suggest this one
customer_reviews.author: buddysbuddy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my AT-LP60!
customer_reviews.text: Just hooked up this amazing little box to my AT-LP60 Stereo Turntable and Yamaha R-S202 Receiver and it sounds amazing! I'm also using 2 Micca bookshelf speakers with my set up. This is exactly what I needed to get volume from my turntable because it doesn't have a built in pre-amp. I definitely recommend this Pro-Ject Phono Box!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works but fidelity is not what I was hoping for. Not bright sound.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Great preamp but died after two years.
customer_reviews.text: The preamp is great but recently it died on me. Would like to get in touch with someone to see about a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME if you like used products
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME if you like used products! Got this and it had been opened and installed. And NO it did not work either. Guess that's why it had been opened.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Left channel stopped working after one week. I can't even get it replaced. Bought a second one, same problem. works for a weak, and then the left channel dies, as soon as I plug in a different (cheaper) preamp, both channels start working again. Complete garbage.
customer_reviews.author: musicisthebest

product_meta.title: Pro-Ject Phono Box MM DC Phonograph Preamplifier,Black
product_meta.description: Since many modern amplifiers no longer have a dedicated phono input, the phono box mm from Pro-Ject is the perfect addition to your turntable setup. Compatible with nearly any moving magnet cartridge, the phono box mm gives you a superb audiophile music experience at an entry-level price. The utilization of advanced circuitry keeps noise and distortion extremely low, and the metallic case and outboard DC power supply keeps the unit free from electromagnetic interference. Since it's only slightly larger than a pack of playing cards, the phono box mm can be placed nearly anywhere. The RCA input and output sockets are gold-plated to preserve sound quality and can be connected directly to any line-level input (aux, CD, Etc.) on your amplifier.
feature_bullets: Compatible with moving Magnet phono cartridges
Dual-mono circuitry for optimized Channel separation
Metal case protects unit from vibrations and electromagnetic interference

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars388 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
